See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report-Specific Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Service Order Type : The service order type related to the appointment you want to display. You must specify the type. Appointment Number : The number of the appointment you want to display. You must specify the number of the appointment.

Appointment Details by Customer Form ID: (FS653000) ([~/?ScreenId=FS653000|FS653000])This report displays information about all inventory items (services, non-stock items, and stock items) included in each appointment, grouped by customer. You can select appointments by customer, customer location, and inventory item. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Report Format : The report format, which in this case indicates the level of detail of data in the report to be generated. The following options are available: Detailed (default): The report shows details on each inventory item. Summary : The report shows summary appointment information for each customer, such as estimated and actual duration of services, quantity of items, and amount. Start Date : The start date for which you want to view information. End Date : The end date for which you want to view information. By default, the current business date is selected. Customer : The customer for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view information on all customers. Location : The customer location for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view information on all customer locations. Inventory : The service, non-stock item, or stock item for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view information on all inventory items. Target Equipment Details : A check box that indicates (if selected) that report will display target equipment information.

Appointment Details by Inventory Item Form ID: (FS653500) ([~/?ScreenId=FS653500|FS653500])This report displays information about all inventory items (services, non-stock items, and stock items) included in each appointment, grouped by inventory item. You can filter appointments by customer, customer location, and inventory item. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the information to be displayed on the report: Report Format : The report format, which in this case indicates the level of detail of the data in the report to be generated. The following options are available: Detailed (default): The report shows details on each inventory item. Summary : The report shows summary appointment information for each inventory item, such as estimated and actual duration of services, quantity of items, and amount. Start Date : The start date for which you want to view information. End Date : The end date for which you want to view information. By default, the current business date is selected. Customer : The customer for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view information on all customers. Location : The customer location for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view information on all customer locations. Inventory : The service, non-stock item, or stock item for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view information on all inventory items.

Appointment Details by Salesperson Form ID: (FS654000) ([~/?ScreenId=FS654000|FS654000])This report displays information about all inventory items (services, non-stock items, and stock items) included in each appointment, grouped by salesperson. You can filter appointments by customer, customer location, and inventory item. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the information to be displayed on the report: Report Format : The report format, which in this case indicates the level of detail of the data in the report to be generated. The following options are available: Detailed (default): The report shows details on each inventory item. Summary : The report shows summary appointment information for each salesperson, such as estimated and actual duration of services, quantity of items, and amount. Start Date : The start date for which you want to view information. End Date : The end date for which you want to view information. By default, the current business date is selected. Customer : The customer for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view information on all customers. Location : The customer location for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view information on all customer locations. Inventory : The service, non-stock item, or stock item for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view information on all inventory items. Salesperson : The salesperson for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view information on all salespersons. Target Equipment Details : A check box that indicates (if selected) that report will display target equipment information.

Appointment Summary Form ID: (FS652500) ([~/?ScreenId=FS652500|FS652500])This report displays summary information about all appointments, grouped by service order type, reference number, and scheduled date. You can select appointments by customer, customer location, and any inventory item related to the service order. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Start Date : The start date for which you want to view data. End Date : The end date for which you want to view data. By default, the current business date is selected. Customer : The customer for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customers. Location : The customer location for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customer locations. Inventory : The service, non-stock item, or stock item for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all inventory items. Open Appointments Only : The check box that indicates (if selected) that report will display appointments with the Open status only.

Appointments in Service Order Form ID: (FS642500) ([~/?ScreenId=FS642500|FS642500])This report displays summary information about the completed appointments of a service order. The report provides the company information (in the top left), contact information, customer information, general information about the appointments, and the total price of the appointments. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the information to be displayed on the report: Service Order Type : The service order type related to the service order for which you want to display data. You must specify the type. Service Order Number : The number of the service order to which the appointments are related. You must specify the number of the service order.

Service Order Form ID: (FS641000) ([~/?ScreenId=FS641000|FS641000])This report displays the selected service order as a ready-to-print document. The document provides the company information (in the top left), contact information, customer information, included services (and their quantities and prices), inventory item information, information about the staff members who perform the services, and the total price of the service order. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report-Specific Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the information to be displayed on the report: Service Order Type : The service order type related to the service order you want to display. You must specify the type. Service Order Number : The number of the service order you want to display. You must specify the number of the service order.

Service Order Details by Customer Form ID: (FS651500) ([~/?ScreenId=FS651500|FS651500])This report displays information about all the inventory items involved in service orders, grouped by customer. You can filter service orders by customer, customer location, or inventory item. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Report Format : The report format, which in this case indicates the level of detail of data in the report to be generated. The following options are available: Detailed (default): The report shows details on each service order. Summary : The report shows summary service order information for each customer, such as estimated duration of services, quantity of items, and amount. Start Date : The start date for which you want to view data. End Date : The end date for which you want to view data. By default, the current business date is selected. Customer : The customer for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customers. Location : The customer location for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customer locations. Inventory : The service, non-stock item, or stock item for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all inventory items. Target Equipment Details : A check box that indicates (if selected) that the report will display target equipment data.

Service Order Details by Inventory Item Form ID: (FS652000) ([~/?ScreenId=FS652000|FS652000])This report displays information about all the inventory items involved in service orders, grouped by the inventory items involved. You can filter service orders by customer, customer location, or inventory item. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Report Format : The report format, which in this case indicates the level of detail of the data in the report to be generated. The following options are available: Detailed (default): The report shows details on each service order. Summary : The report shows summary service order information for each item, such as estimated duration of services, quantity of items, and amount. Start Date : The start date for which you want to view data. End Date : The end date for which you want to view data. By default, the current business date is selected. Customer : The customer for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customers. Location : The customer location for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customer locations. Inventory : The service, non-stock item, or stock item for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all inventory items.

Service Order Summary Form ID: (FS651000) ([~/?ScreenId=FS651000|FS651000])This report displays summary information about all service orders, grouped by service order type, reference number, and date. You can select service orders by customer, customer location, or any inventory item related to the service order. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Start Date : The start date for which you want to view data. End Date : The end date for which you want to view data. By default, the current business date is selected. Customer : The customer for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customers. Location : The customer location for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customer locations. Inventory : The service, non-stock item, or stock item for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all inventory items. Open Service Orders Only : A check box that indicates (if selected) that report will display service orders with the Open status only.

Service Time Activity by Customer Form ID: (FS655500) ([~/?ScreenId=FS655500|FS655500])This report displays information about employee time activities, grouped by customer. You can select time activities by customer, customer location, staff member, service, service order, and appointment. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Report Format : The report format, which in this case indicates the level of detail of data in the report to be generated. The following options are available: Detailed (default): The report shows details on each activity of each staff member. Summary : The report shows summary information for each customer, such as actual duration. Start Date : The start date for which you want to view data. End Date : The end date for which you want to view data. By default, the current business date is selected. Customer : The customer for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customers. Location : The customer location for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customer locations. Staff Member : The staff member for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all staff members. Service : The service for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all services. Target Equipment Details : A check box that indicates (if selected) that the report will display target equipment data.

Service Time Activity by Staff Member Form ID: (FS655000) ([~/?ScreenId=FS655000|FS655000])This report displays information about time activities, grouped by staff member. You can select time activities by customer, customer location, staff member, service, service order, and appointment. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Report Format : The report format, which in this case indicates the level of detail of data in the report to be generated. The following options are available: Detailed (default): The report shows details on each activity of each staff member. Summary : The report shows summary information for each staff member, such as actual duration. Start Date : The start date for which you want to view data. End Date : The end date for which you want to view data. By default, the current business date is selected. Customer : The customer for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customers. Location : The customer location for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customer locations. Staff Member : The staff member for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all staff members. Service : The service for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all services. Target Equipment Details : A check box that indicates (if selected) that the report will display target equipment data.

Service Time Activity Summary Form ID: (FS654500) ([~/?ScreenId=FS654500|FS654500])This report displays summary information about all time activities of the staff members, grouped by service order type and reference number. You can select time activities by customer, customer location, staff member, service, service order, and appointment. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Start Date : The start date for which you want to view data. End Date : The end date for which you want to view data. By default, the current business date is selected. Customer : The customer for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customers. Location : The customer location for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customer locations. Staff Member : The staff member for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all staff members. Service : The service for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all services. Target Equipment Details : A check box that indicates (if selected) that the report will display target equipment information. Service Order Type : The service order type for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all service order types. Service Order Nbr. : The number of the service order for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all service orders. Appointment Nbr. : The number of the appointment for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all appointments.

Resource Equipment History Form ID: (FS656500) ([~/?ScreenId=FS656500|FS656500])This report displays information about the appointments for which resource equipment was used. You can select appointments by customer, customer location, and resource equipment used. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the information to be displayed on the report: Report Format : The report format, which in this case indicates the level of detail of data in the report to be generated. The following options are available: Detailed (default): The report shows details on each piece of resource equipment. Summary : The report shows summary information for each piece of equipment, such as the total duration of services. Start Date : The start date for which you want to view data. End Date : The end date for which you want to view data. By default, the current business date is selected. Customer : The customer for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view information on all customers. Location : The customer location for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customer locations. Resource Equipment : The identifier of the resource equipment for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all resource equipment.

row.PlainText: Resource Equipment List Form ID: (FS656000) ([~/?ScreenId=FS656000|FS656000])This report displays information about resource equipment registered in the system. You can select equipment by its type. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameter to select the information to be displayed on the report: Equipment Type : The equipment type for which you want to view information. Leave the box blank to view information on all equipment types.

Taxes Reports With the Acumatica ERP reports related to taxes, you can view key tax-related information. If a report contains data links, you can easily drill down from the report to any supporting details. A report includes only the objects or entities that the user running the report is authorized to access, based on the user's roles and membership in restriction groups. All tax-related reports can be generated in different formats, including PDF and HTML, and can be printed or sent by email. For more information about reports, see Reports. Each of the topics of this chapter provides reference information about a particular Acumatica ERP report, including details about the applicable report parameters you can use to select the exact data you want to view and analyze.

row.column: Tax Details Form ID: (TX620500) ([~/?ScreenId=TX620500|TX620500])On this form, you can prepare a detailed tax report for the specified closed or prepared tax reporting period and the selected tax agency. The report contains the list of report lines itemized by the list of documents that were used to compute the amount in a report line. The report uses the currency of the selected tax agency. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Company : The company for which the report will be prepared. By default, the current company is selected. Branch : The branch for which the report will be prepared. This box is available only if the Multi-Branch Support feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, and only if the company selected in the Company box has the With Branches Requiring Balancing type and the File Taxes by Branches check box selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS101500|CS101500]) Companies (CS101500) form. Tax Agency : The applicable tax agency. Select a tax agency, or leave this box empty to view information on all tax agencies. Tax Period : The period to be reported on. Select a period, or leave the box blank to view information on all closed or prepared tax periods.

Tax Details by GL Account by Date Form ID: (TX622500) ([~/?ScreenId=TX622500|TX622500])This report displays tax information for the selected tax agency, grouped by GL account and by tax. Transactions are listed by tax period. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Company : The company for which the report will be prepared. By default, the current company is selected. Branch : The branch for which the report will be prepared. This box is available only if the Multi-Branch Support feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, and only if the company selected in the Company box has the With Branches Requiring Balancing type and the File Taxes by Branches check box selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS101500|CS101500]) Companies (CS101500) form. From Date : The start date of the date range for which you want to view tax information. To Date : The end date of the date range for which you want to view tax information. Tax Agency : The tax agency for which tax information will be displayed. Select a tax agency, or leave this box empty to view information on all tax agencies. Tax : The tax for which you want to view information. Select a tax, or leave the box blank to view information on all taxes associated with the tax agency.

Tax Details by GL Account by Period Form ID: (TX621500) ([~/?ScreenId=TX621500|TX621500])This report displays tax information for the selected tax agency, grouped by GL account and by tax. Transactions are listed by tax period. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Company : The company for which the report will be prepared. By default, the current company is selected. Branch : The branch for which the report will be prepared. This box is available only if the Multi-Branch Support feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, and only if the company selected in the Company box has the With Branches Requiring Balancing type and the File Taxes by Branches check box selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS101500|CS101500]) Companies (CS101500) form. Tax Agency : The tax agency to be reported. Select a tax agency, or leave this box empty to view information on all tax agencies. Tax Period : The reporting period the report will cover. Select a period, or leave the box blank to view information on all closed or prepared tax periods. Tax : The tax (by its ID) for which you want to view information. Select a tax, or leave the box blank to view information on all taxes associated with the tax agency.

Tax Summary Form ID: (TX621000) ([~/?ScreenId=TX621000|TX621000])On this form, you can prepare a report that shows the summary tax information for the specified closed or prepared tax reporting period for the selected tax agency. The report lists the tax report lines with their respective amounts. The report uses the currency of the tax agency. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Company : The company for which the report will be prepared. By default, the current company is selected. Branch : The branch for which the report will be prepared. This box is available only if the Multi-Branch Support feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, and only if the company selected in the Company box has the With Branches Requiring Balancing type and the File Taxes by Branches check box selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS101500|CS101500]) Companies (CS101500) form. Tax Agency : The applicable tax agency. Select a tax agency, or leave this box empty to view information on all tax agencies. Tax Period : The period to be reported on. Select a period, or leave the box blank to view information on all closed or prepared tax periods.

Tax Summary by GL Account by Date Form ID: (TX623000) ([~/?ScreenId=TX623000|TX623000])This report displays tax information for the selected tax agency and time interval. Transactions are listed by GL account, tax, module (part of the system from which they originated), and date. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Company : The company for which the report will be prepared. By default, the current company is selected. Branch : The branch for which the report will be prepared. This box is available only if the Multi-Branch Support feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, and only if the company selected in the Company box has the With Branches Requiring Balancing type and the File Taxes by Branches check box selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS101500|CS101500]) Companies (CS101500) form. From Date : The start date of the date range for which you want to view tax information. To Date : The end date of the date range for which you want to view tax information. Tax Agency : The tax agency for which tax information will be displayed. Select a tax agency, or leave this box empty to view information on all tax agencies. Tax : The tax for which you want to view information. Select a tax, or leave the box blank to view information on all taxes associated with the tax agency.

Tax Summary by GL Account by Period Form ID: (TX622000) ([~/?ScreenId=TX622000|TX622000])In this report, for a particular tax agency and a closed or prepared tax period, you can view the taxable and tax amounts by general ledger account. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Company : The company for which the report will be prepared. By default, the current company is selected. Branch : The branch for which the report will be prepared. This box is available only if the Multi-Branch Support feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, and only if the company selected in the Company box has the With Branches Requiring Balancing type and the File Taxes by Branches check box selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS101500|CS101500]) Companies (CS101500) form. Tax Agency : The tax agency for which tax information will be displayed. Select a tax agency, or leave this box empty to view information on all tax agencies. Tax Period : The reporting period the report will cover. Select a period, or leave the box blank to view information on all closed or prepared tax periods. Tax : The tax (by its ID) for which you want to view information. Select a tax, or leave the box blank to view information on all taxes associated with the tax agency.

VAT Pending Recognition Form ID: (TX631000) ([~/?ScreenId=TX631000|TX631000])This report lists the documents that have a value-added tax (VAT) balance pending recognition at the end of the selected financial period. (For details about the recognition of pending VAT, see Recognition of Pending VAT.) By using this report, you can reconcile the documents that have unrecognized VAT amounts with the balances of the Pending Tax Payable and Pending Tax Claimable accounts. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: Report Format : The format, which in this case defines which taxes the report will cover. The following options are available: Output VAT : The report will include documents that are subject to pending VAT of the Output reporting group—that is, VAT that must be reported to a tax agency. Input VAT : The report will include documents that are subject to pending VAT of the Input reporting group—that is, the taxes that can be claimed from a tax agency. Company : The company for which the report will be prepared. By default, the current company is selected. Branch : The branch for which the report should be prepared. To include all documents with VAT pending recognition in the report, leave this box empty. This box is available only if the Multi-Branch Support feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, and only if the company selected in the Company box has the With Branches Requiring Balancing type and the File Taxes by Branches check box selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS101500|CS101500]) Companies (CS101500) form. Financial Period : The tax period that the report should cover. To include all documents with a VAT balance pending recognition, clear this box. By default, the period of the current business date is used. Account : The account whose tax amounts pending recognition should be included in the report. Accounts that hold tax amounts pending recognition are those specified for value-added taxes in the Pending Tax Payable Account or Pending Tax Claimable Account box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=TX205000|TX205000]) Taxes (TX205000) form. Leave this box blank to view VAT amounts pending recognition for all accounts. Subaccount : The subaccount whose VAT amounts pending recognition should be included in the report. Subaccounts that hold tax amounts pending recognition are those specified for value-added taxes in the Pending Tax Payable Subaccount or Pending Tax Claimable Subaccount box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=TX205000|TX205000]) Taxes form. Leave this box blank to view VAT amounts pending recognition for all subaccounts. This box is available only if the Subaccounts feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form.

User Security Reports The Acumatica ERP reports related to user security provide information that can be useful for employees who manage users, roles, and access rights to system objects. You can use these reports for analyzing, optimizing, and restructuring user accounts, user roles, and access rights. If a report contains data links, you can easily drill down from the report to any supporting details. A report includes only the objects or entities that the user running the report is authorized to access, based on the user's roles and membership in restriction groups. All reports related to user security can be generated in different formats, including PDF and HTML, and can be printed or sent by email. For more information about reports, see Reports. Each of the topics of this chapter provides reference information about a particular Acumatica ERP report, including details about the applicable report parameters you can use to select the exact data you want to view and analyze.

row.PlainText: Access Rights by Role Form ID: (SM651500) ([~/?ScreenId=SM651500|SM651500])This report lists the roles available in the system and their access rights to system forms. Only those forms for which access rights were set up explicitly at the form, module, or suite level are displayed in the report. The report has no report-specific parameters. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports.

Access Rights by Screen Form ID: (SM651700) ([~/?ScreenId=SM651700|SM651700])This report lists all system forms with user roles for which access rights to the form have been set up explicitly at the form, module, or suite level. Each role's level of access rights to the form is displayed. The report has no report-specific parameters. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports.

row.column: Role List Form ID: (SM651000) ([~/?ScreenId=SM651000|SM651000])This report lists the roles available in the system and the user accounts assigned to each role. The report can be created in a summary or detailed format. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, use the following parameter to select the information to be displayed on the report: Format : The format in which you want to generate the report. Select one of the following options: Detailed : Displays the list of roles, with the description of each role and the total number of users with the role assigned. For each role, lists the users with the role assigned and the basic information, including email address, for each user. Summary : Displays the list of roles, with the description of each role and the total number of users who have the role assigned.

User List Form ID: (SM650500) ([~/?ScreenId=SM650500|SM650500])This report, which can be created in a summary or detailed format, displays the existing user accounts and their key properties. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, use the following parameter to select the information to be displayed on the report: Format : The format in which you want to generate the report. Select one of the following options: Detailed : Displays the complete list of user accounts with key account properties (such as first and last name, and password security options). For each account, the report lists the roles assigned to the account. Summary : Displays the complete list of user accounts with key account properties (such as first and last name, and password security options).
